summary: I OWN A 2002 TMIBERLAND RV., THAT HAS A DOMETIC REFRIGERATOR MD.# RM 2652, SERIAL # 11303374. THE REFRIGERATOR STOPPED COOLING, SO I PHONE A RV. REPAIRMAN, HE CAME OUT AND SAID " THE REASON FOR THIS FAILURE IS DUE TO A  BOILER TUBE THAT WAS DEFECTIVE AND DOMETIC HAS A RECALL ON THEM AND THEY COULD CAUSE A FIRE. HOWEVER WHEN I CALLED DOMETIC THEY SAID " WE DON'T REPLACE THE COOLING UNITS, WE JUST GIVE YOU A HEAT SHIELD TO PROTECT AGAINST FIRES.  IF THEY HAVE A DEFECTIVE BOILING TUBE THAT MAKES THE REFRIGERATOR GO OUT AND CAUSE FIRES, THEN THEY SHOULD BE REQUIRED TO REPLACE THE UNIT. JUST LIKE TOYOTA! *TR

COMPLETE ENGINE FAILURE CAUSING LOSS OF BRAKES, STEERING AND POWER FROM KNOWN ISSUE ON 6.5 TURBO DIESEL ENGINE FROM PMD FAILURE CAUSING FUEL INJECTOR PUMP TO SHUT OFF CAUSING ENGINE FAILURE. THIS HAPPENS ON ALL VEHICLES WITH 6.5TD ENGINE AND ESPECIALLY IN MY 2002 AM GENERAL H1 HUMMER WHERE WE ALMOST DIED. *TR
2002 ARCTIC CAT MOUNTAIN 800 LE, GAS TANK FILLER OPENING HAS A HAIR LINE CRACK BELOW THE THREADS AND IS LEAKING FUEL ALL OVER. *TR

TL*THE CONTACT OWNS A 2002 SUNDOWNER HORSE TRAILER.  THE CONTACT NOTICED CHUNKS OF RUST PEELING FROM THE FRAME AND BLISTERING ON THE SIDE OF THE TRAILER.  THE TRAILER WAS TAKEN TO THE DEALER AND THEY STATED THAT THERE WAS FAILURE WITH THE STEEL, WHICH LED TO OXIDATION AND  CAUSED THE FRAME TO PEEL.  THE DEALER SENT THE TRAILER TO A LOCAL REPAIR SHOP TO HAVE THE FRAME SANDBLASTED.  A COUPLE OF WEEKS LATER, THE CONTACT NOTICED THAT THE FRAME BEGAN TO RUST AND PEEL AGAIN.  THE TRAILER WAS TAKEN BACK TO THE DEALER WHERE IT WAS DETERMINED THAT THE FRAME WAS UNABLE TO BE REPAIRED AND NEEDED TO BE REPLACED.  THE MANUFACTURER STATED THAT THE FAILURE WAS COSMETIC, RATHER THAN STRUCTURAL AND WOULD NOT BE COVERED UNDER WARRANTY.  THE TRAILER'S WARRANTY DOES NOT EXPIRE UNTIL 2010.  THE FAILURE MILEAGE WAS NOT APPLICABLE.    UPDATED 12/30/08  *BF  UPDATED 01/05/09

TL*THE CONTACT OWNS A 2002 PERAVES AG ECOMOBILE (NA).  WHILE DRIVING 65 MPH, THE TUBE THAT SUPPORTS THE TOP OF THE REAR SHOCK ABSORBER FAILED.  AS A RESULT, THE REAR WHEEL WAS NOT PROPERLY CONNECTED TO THE VEHICLE.  THE CONTACT REPLACED THE FRAME AND THERE HAD BEEN NO FURTHER OCCURRENCES.  WHILE DRIVING 65 MPH, THE VEHICLE WOULD NOT STOP WHEN THE BRAKE PEDAL WAS DEPRESSED AND THE REAR WHEEL WOBBLED.  THE CONTACT PUMPED THE BRAKES IN ORDER TO STOP THE VEHICLE.  THE DEALER STATED THAT THE WHEEL BEARINGS AND REAR DRIVE GEAR CAUSED THE FAILURE AND THEY REPLACED THE WHEEL BEARINGS.  THE CONTACT STATED THAT THE STUD THAT HELD THE REAR SHOCK ABSORBER TO THE REAR DRIVE TUBE FAILED.  THE STUDS WERE REPLACED WITH A STRONGER STUD AND THERE HAD BEEN NO FAILURES SINCE.  THE CONTACT FELT THAT THE DRIVETRAIN WAS NOT EQUIPPED FOR THIS VEHICLE.  THE POWERTRAIN WAS UNKNOWN.  THE FAILURE MILEAGE WAS 20,000 AND CURRENT MILEAGE WAS 74,956.
DOMETIC SAFETY RECALL NOTICE 06E-076 CUSTOMER STATES THAT THE REPAIR KIT IS JUST A BAND-AID FOR THE PROBLEM AND NOT A FIX. **CC  THE CONSUMER PROVIDED A COPY OF THE SAFETY RECALL NOTICE.  *TR

I ORDERED A 2002 TRAILS WEST GOOSE NECK TRAILER AND ON LABOR DAY WEEKEND 2003 THE TRAILER BROKE AT THE NECK.  MY HORSE WAS HURT IN THE ACCIDENT.  I FOUGHT WITH THE COMPANY FOR THE TOWING BILL, AND FOR THE MONEY TO REPLACE MY HORSE.  I FINALLY QUIT FIGHTING WITH THEM UNTIL NOW BECAUSE I FOUND ANOTHER GENTLEMAN WHO HAS THE SAME 2002 TRAILER AND HAD THE SAME PROBLEM

I OWN A HONDA MOTORCYCLE GL1800 GOLDWING,  IT STARTING A SHIMMY OR WOBBLE AT LOW SPEEDS WHEN BOTH HANDS ARE REMOVED FROM THE HANDLEBARS AT ANY TIME.. THE HONDA DEALERSHIP STATED IT WAS BAD TIRES AND I BOUGHT A NEW SET OF TIRES.  IT APPEARED THE SHIMMY OR WOBBLE STOPPED FOR A SHORT TIME THEN BEGAN AGAIN.  THE TIRES WERE AGAIN REPLACED AND ONLY FOR A COUPLE HUNDRED MILES DID THE SHIMMY/WOBBLE SEEM TO CEASE THEN AGAIN BEGAN.  AFTER TALKING WITH THE DEALERSHIP AGAIN I WAS INFORMED IT IS WEAK FRON FORKS THAT CAUSE IT AND THAT IS WHY IT DOES NOT OCCUR AT HIGHER SPEEDS.    I HAVE SPOKEN WITH SEVERAL OTHER OWNERS OF HONDA GOLDWINGS WHACH ALL AGREE THE SAME IS OCCURRING TO THEM.  IT IS REFERED TO AS A SLOW SPEED WOBBLE WHERE THE HANDLE BARS VIOLENTLY SHAKE SIDE TO SIDE UNTIL ONE OR BOTH HANDS ARE PLACED UPON THE HANDLEBARS.  I REALIZE FOR SAFETY ONE SHOULD ALWAYS HOLD THE HANDLE BARS AS SO WITH A STEERING WHEEL ON AN AUTOMOBILE YET SOMETIMES ONE MUCT REMOVE BOTH HANDS FOR A SECOND TO DO SOMETHING AND THE MOTORCYCLE WOBBLES VIOLENTLY TO THE DANGER POINT.  IF ONE TOOK THEIR HANDS OFF AN AUTOMOBILE FOR A MOMENT THE STEERING WHEEL DOESNT SHAKE FROM SIDE TO SIDE VIOLENTLY.. NEITHER DO OTHER MOTORCYCLES.  IN THE FOLLOWING SECTION I HAD TO USE UNKNOWN MANUFACTUR ETC BECAUSE THERE IS NO PROVISION FOR A HONDA MOTORCYCLE.  ONLY HONDA CARS.

IN 2002 I PURCHASED A NEW BOAT FROM SEA RAY BOATS WITH A SHORELANDER TRAILER.  IT IS EQUIPPED WITH GOODYEAR MARATHON TIRES IN SIZE 215/75R14.  THEY ARE C LOAD RATING TIRES WITH 1870 LB RATING.  THE BOAT AND TRAILER ARE 5500 LB MAXIMUM WITH ALL EQUIPMENT AND FULL LOAD OF FUEL.  LAST FALL IN OCTOBER WHILE DRIVING TO THE LAKE AT HIGHWAY SPEED THE LEFT FRONT TIRE EXPLODED.  I PULLED OVER AND PUT ON THE SPARE.  GOODYEAR REPLACED THE TIRE.  TWO WEEKS AFTER THAT WHILE PREPPING THE BOAT AND TRAILER FOR ANOTHER TRIP, I ALWAYS CHECK TIRES, WHEELS AND BEARING CONDITION BEFORE TOWING, I NOTICED TWO OF THE TIRES HAD BULGES IN THE TREAD.  I TOOK THEM TO THE STORE AND GOODYEAR REPLACED THEM.  OF COURSE EVERY TIME A TIRE GOT REPLACED I HAD TO PAY A PRO-RATE, MOUNT AND BALANCE CHARGES, AND TAXES.  I REQUESTED GOODYEAR REPLACE THE FOURTH TIRE SINCE IT WAS THE ONLY REMAINING TIRE IN USE THAT DIDN'T FAIL.  THEY REPLACED IT AS A PEACE OF MIND GESTURE.  NOW JUST THIS PAST WEEKEND 7/2/06, I CHECKED OVER THE TRAILER AS USUAL AND ALL WAS OK.  THEN AS I WAS PULLING OUT OF THE DRIVEWAY I SAW SOMETHING FUNNY IN THE MIRROR.  WHEN I GOT OUT TO INSPECT IT I FOUND ONE OF THE TIRES THEY JUST REPLACE HAD A GIANT BULGE IN THE SIDE WALL.  THE LITTLE NUBS HAVEN'T EVEN WORN OF THE TIRE YET IT'S SO NEW.  BOY WAS I MAD!!!!!!  GOODYEAR IS REPLACING IT FOR NO CHARGE THIS TIME.  WHEN I ASKED ABOUT GETTING DIFFERENT TIRES THEY SAID THERE WAS NOTHING THEY COULD DO.  THIS TIRE SHOULD BE RECALLED FOR SAFETY REASONS.  THEY ARE UNSAFE.  *NM
CHEVY TRAILBLAZER HAS A CLICKING NOISE UNDER THE DASH     HAPPENS WHEN THE A/C  SWITCHES MODES.  *JB

DURING EXTREME COLD WEATHER (IE. LESS THAN 10 DEGREES) MY BMW X5 OVERHEATED AND LEAKED OIL. BROUGHT TO MY REPAIR SHOP WHERE THEY HAD A SIMILAR PROBLEM W/ SAME MODEL BROUGHT IN THE DAY BEFORE. BROUGHT THE CAR TO BMW DEALERSHIP WHERE IT WAS DIAGNOSED AS HAVING A BROKEN OIL SEPARATOR VALVE COVER ( A DEFECTIVE VALVE COVER WHICH BMW HAS ALREADY ACKNOWLEDGED AS A PROBLEM BECAUSE THEY NOW HAVE A NEW PART TO REPLACE IT). BMW HAS NOT ISSUED A RECALL AND DENIED MY REQUEST TO REPAIR IT WITHOUT CHARGE AS THE CAR IS NO LONGER UNDER WARRANTY.  *NM

ON JULY 25, 2005, OUR 2002 DODGE GRAND CARAVAN SPORT, EMITTED A LOUD NOISE AND THE PASSENGER SIDE WINDOW FELL DOWN INTO DOOR PANEL.  UPON EXAMINATION THE AUTOMATIC WINDOW TOGGLE SWITCH WOULD NOT MAKE THE WINDOW RISE BACK UP.  AFTER TALKING WITH A MECHANIC IN TOWN - IT WAS ADVISED THAT THE WINDOW MOTOR AND REGULATOR WOULD NEED TO BE REPLACED FOR A TOTAL $250.00.    IN ADDITION, A MONTH 1/2 LATER ON SEPT. 10, 2005, THE DRIVER SIDE WINDOW FELL DOWN INTO DOOR PANEL AND WAS EXAMINED AND WAS ADVISED THE SAME PROBLEM OCCURS WITH THE DRIVER SIDE WINDOW AS DOES WITH THE PASSENGER SIDE WINDOW.    IT IS MY UNDERSTANDING THAT PARTS DO MALFUNCTION, HOWEVER, IT IS UNBELIEVABLE THAT ON A VEHICLE THAT IS 3 YEARS OLD THAT NOT ONE (1) BUT TWO (2) IDENTICAL PARTS WOULD MALFUNCTION.      DUE TO THESE RECENT MALFUNCTIONS I AM FILING THIS COMPLAINT FOR MORE INFORMATION IN REGARDS TO ANY RECALLS THAT EXIST THAT WOULD REPLACE THESE PARTS SO THAT I CAN TAKE THE PLASTIC AND WOOD SHIMMIES OFF MY WINDOWS.  IF ANYONE HAS ANY INFORMATION REGARDING THIS PLEASE CONTACT ME AT ALANKFORD458@YAHOO.COM.  I WOULD BE VERY MUCH APPRECIATIVE AND AM CURIOUS IF I AM THE ONLY ONE WITH GHOSTLY WINDOWS.  *NM

DT:  THE CONSUMER OWNS A KZ SPORTSMAN 5TH WHEEL TRAILER.  THE MICROWAVE LED LIGHT DID NOT WORK, SO HE CONTACTED THE DEALER AND WAS SENT A REPLACEMENT.  WHEN HE REMOVED THE ORIGINAL OVEN HE FOUND A SIGN ON THE SIDE STATING, MA BE BUILT INTO A CABINET STRUCTURE BUT NOT TO BE USED ADJACENT TO (WITHIN TWO FEET OF) ANY GAS OR ELECTRIC RANGE COOK TOP OR OVEN.  IT IS APPROXIMATELY 9 INCHES BELOW THE COOK GRILL.THE MANUFACTURER OF THE TRAILER WAS NOT IN THE LIST, IT IS A KZ SPORTMAN 5TH WHEEL.  THE ADDRESS IS 9270 W. US 20, SHIPSHEWANNA, IN. 46565.  THIS IS A SHARP MICROWAVE, MODEL NUMBER R820BK.  *JB

WE PURCHASED A SET OF AFTERMARKET WHEELS AND TIRES FROM WHEELMAX. THE BRAND NAME WAS EXCEL. MY SON WAS DRIVING ALONG AND HIT A SMALL POTHOLE AND THE WHEEL SHATTERED IN HALF. LUCKILY HE WAS NOT TRAVELING AT A HIGH RATE OF SPEED OR HE COULD OF LOST CONTROL OF THE CAR.
DT: CONTACT STATES  2002 MALAGUTTI MOTOR SCOOTER FELL OVER AND RUPTURED THE FUEL TANK.  THERE ARE NO LOCAL SERVICE DEALERS IN THE AREA.     *AK

DT:  TRANSMISSION LOCKED UP DURING RIDING, CREATING A DANGEROUS CONDITION, AND LOCKING UP THE REAR WHEEL. WHEN THE MOTORCYCLE LOCKED UP THE MOTORCYCLE WENT INTO A TAIL SPIN. A HAZARDOUS THAT COULD HAVE BEEN FATAL. THE MANUFACTURER IS NESCO INC, THE BIKE IS A BOSS HOSS, BHC-3. THE CONSUMER HAS REMOVED THE TRANSMISSION AND SHIPPED IT BACK TO THE MANUFACTURER.    *TT

NO SINGLE THING SEEMS TO HAVE CONTRIBUTED TO THE FAILURE. 6 OF THE 7 TIRES BLEW IN THE SAME PLACE. THE OTHER WAS READY TO BLOW WITH SEPERATED BANDS. AS THESE WERE RADIALS, I WENT BACK TO BIAS PLY TIRES SO 7 TIRES WERE BOUGHT TO REPLACE THE RADIALS. THESE ARE CARLISLE TRAILER TIRES. *AK

FOR SEVERAL MONTHS NOW, THE HEADLIGHTS IN MY 2002 SATURN L200 WILL FLASH IN A STROBE-LIKE FASHION.  THE SATURN DEALERSHIP IN LEXINGTON, KY SAYS THIS IS "NORMAL" AND THEY CAN'T FIX IT.  THE IDEA THAT HIGHLIGHTS GOING NEARLY OFF AT INTERSTATE SPEEDS IS "NORMAL" IS ABSURD.  SOMETHING NEEDS TO BE DONE TO SOLVE THIS OBVIOUSLY UNSAFE CONDITION. *JB

MY 2002 SUNNY BROOK 5TH WHEEL CAME WITH GOODYEAR WRANGLER HT 225/75R16 "E" TIRES. I HAD MY FIRST TIRE SEPARATION IN JUNE 2004. DAMAGE WAS OVER $2000 TO MY TRAILER. SECOND TIRE SEPARATION WAS SEPT 2004. I SAW THE TREAD SEPARATE IN MY SIDE MIRROR AND WAS ABLE TO GET OFF THE INTERSTATE BEFORE IT WENT FLAT. NO DAMAGE TO THE TRAILER THAT TIME. THE THIRD TIRE SEPARATION WAS NOV 14, 2004. THE TIRE STAYED INFLATED, BUT THE TREAD AND BROKEN BELTS HAS CAUSED MORE DAMAGE TO THE WHEEL WELL, FENDER AND SKIRTING. THE DOT# IS MK1LMMHV1202. GOODYEAR WAS INFORMED OF THE FIRST TIRE FAILURE WITHIN A COUPLE OF DAYS OF INCIDENT. THEY DID NOT INFORM ME OF ANY PROBLEMS OR OFFER TO REPLACE THE OTHER 4 TIRES. I HAVE FILED A NEW COMPLAINT WITH GOODYEAR, AND THEY HAVE OFFERED TO REPLACE THE REMAINING TIRES AND PAY FOR ALL DAMAGES. *AK
MIRRORS ON MY 2002 BMW F650 DAKAR REQUIRE CONSTANT ADJUSTMENTS AT HIGHWAY SPEEDS.CAUSING AN UNSAFE SITUATION IN TRAFFIC.

DURING A 1000 MILE ROUNDTRIP FROM MICHIGAN TO TENNESSE, 4 OF THE 5 (INCLUDING THE SPARE) CARLISLE TIRES (175, 80 R13) ON OUR 2002 HI-LO BLEW OUT.  THE LAST BLOW OUT WAS THE ORIGINAL SPARE WICH HAD LESS THAN 600 MILES ON IT.  ALL THE TIRES WERE PROPERLY INFLATED PRIOR TO THE START OF THE TRIP.  THE TRAILER WAS OVERLOADED NOR WERE WE SPEEDING.  THE FIRST BLOW OUT TOOK OUT THE SEPTIC SYSTEM OF THE TRAILER SENDING PLASTIC PARTS ALL ACROSS THE HIGHWAY.  ALL THE TIRES SEEMED TO FAIL IN THE SAME WAY, THE SIDEWALL APPEARED TO GIVE WAY AND THE TREAD SEPARATED. *AK

MY MOTORCYCLE (INDEPENDENCE BRAND -- MODEL IS FREEDOM EXPRESS) HAS SOME TYPE OF SHORTAGE IN THE LIGHTING SYSTEM.  THE BLINKERS WORK WHEN AND IF THEY WANT TO.  THEY WILL COME ON SOMETIMES ON THEIR OWN...AND I AM UNABLE TO CUT THEM OFF.  WHEN I WANT THEM TO COME ON, SOMETIMES THEY WILL AND SOMETIMES THEY WON'T.  THE BIKE HAS BEEN TO TWO DEALERS TO BE FIXED.  HAS BEEN IN THE SHOP A TOTAL OF ABOUT 10 TIMES.  I WAS MAKING A LEFT TURN INTO MY DRIVEWAY RECENTLY AND SOMEONE PASSED ME ON THE LEFT.  I AM ASSUMING THE BLINKER QUIT WORKING.  THEY RAN INTO ME.  FORTUNATELY, I WAS NOT FULLY INTO MY TURN AND THEY SIDE SWIPED ME.  *JB
VEHICLE HAD NUMEROUS PROBLEMS, AND CONSUMER FELT THAT IT WAS A CASE OF A POOR QUALITY CONTROL.  *LA  (NAR)   *CB

MAJOR ELECTRICAL FAILURES IN TRAIL MANOR RECREATIONAL VEHICLE.  BATTERY FROM RV DRAINS BATTERY FROM MOTOR VEHICLE, WHICH COULD CAUSE COMPLETE BRAKE MALFUNCTION.  *JB
CARLISLE TRAILER TIRES TREAD SEPARATION/CHUNKING.  *AK

ON 07/18/03 I WAS NOTIFIED BY A PASSING MOTORIST OF A FLAT TIRE ON THE RIGHT REAR AXLE OF MY TRAVEL TRAILER. I FOUND THE TIRE HAD A LARGE PIECE OF THE SIDEWALL MISSING AND THE CORDS AND BELTS STICKING OUT. I REPLACED IT WITH ANOTHER BRAND TIRE. AFTER THE VERY NEXT TIME I USED THE TRAILER,ON 08/08/03 APPROXIMATELY 300 MILES LATER,THE LEFT REAR TIRE DEVELOPED A LARGE BUBBLE ON THE SHOULDER OF THE TREAD. I WAS ABLE TO CATCH IT BEFORE IT BLEW. I REPLACED IT WITH ANOTHER BRAND AS BEFORE BUT WAS ABLE TO KEEP IT, AS BY THIS TIME I KNEW THE TIRES WERE DEFECTIVE. ONLY 40 MILES LATER ON 08/14/03 I HAD THE LEFT FRONT TIRE BLOW. AFTER CHANGING THE TIRE ON SIDE OF THE ROAD FOR THE SECOND TIME I REPLACED BOTH FRONT TIRES WITH GOODYEARS, BECAUSE EACH TIME I WAS UNABLE TO FIND A DEALER THAT STOCKED THE CORRECT SIZE CARLILSE TIRE. BOTH TIRES THAT BLEW WHERE SEVERLY DAMAGED. THE ONE I HAVE WITH THE BUBBLE HAS ALSO GOT A BUBBLE ON THE INSIDE. I CHECK MY TIRES FOR CONDITION AND PSI BEFORE EACH TRIP AND AM NOWHERE NEAR THE WIEGHT LIMIT OF THE TRAILER OR THE TIRES. AS AN ASE CERTIFIED MASTER TECH IN MED/HEAVY DUTY TRUCK REPAIR WITH 20 YEARS EXPERIENCE I FEEL SOMEWHAT QUALIFIED TO SAY THIS IS A DEFECTIVE PRODUCT THAT SHOULD BE RECALLED! *AK

NEW (2002) BOAT TRAILER (VENTURE VRT-5400/23) IS MISSING SURGE BRAKE SAFETY PIN. LATCH MECHANISM IS MISSING HOLE TO ALLOW COMPLETE INSERTION OF PIN AND BRAKE HOUSING HAS IMPROPERLY DRILLED HOLE (FIGURE 8 SHAPE). SURGE BRAKE IS TIE-DOWN ENGINEERING MODEL TDE-66 (S/N 15660 WITH S/N 15661 SAFETY PIN LANYARD).*AK
REDNECK ENGINEERING FRAME BROKE AT REAR END HOOP.  *NLM

MOTORCYCLE DISTRIBUTED BY CLASSIC MOTORCYCLES & SIDECARS, INC. AND DESCRIBED AS: FLYING TIGER, QM250-H. ON APRIL 29, 2003 THE CLUTCH CABLE BROKE AT THE LEVER AS I WAS ATTEMPTING TO SWITCH INTO THIRD GEAR, THIS CAUSED SOME LOSS OF CONTROL AND A CONFUSING SITUATION THAT COULD HAVE EASILY RESULTED IN INJURY OR DEATH.    *JB
ON 5/21/03, I RENTED A CARGO VAN FROM BUDGET RENTAL AT 3911 N. WESTERN AVENUE, CHICAGO (OKLAHOMA LICENSE PLATE 2AB-665) AND NOTICED THAT THE LAST INSPECTION DATE WAS MARCH 2002.

THIS BRAND OF SEXTON RIPPER MOTORCYCLE DID NOT HAVE AN AXEL LONG ENOUGH TO ACCOMMODATE THE PROPER SAFETY NUT. A CASTLE NUT IS IN PLACE, BUT THE THREADS DID NOT EVEN PROTRUDE FAR ENOUGH TO MAKE IT TO THE NUT, AND REQUIRED A COTTER PIN. IF ANYTHING, A LOCK NUT SHOULD HAVE BEEN USED. THE NUT BECAME LOOSE EVERY 500 MILES.  *AK   *JB *SEXTON RIPPER 2002, MANUFACTURER INDIAN
EXHAUST SYSTEM OF MERCEDES C230K SPORT CAUSED FIRE IN TRUNK.   *NLM

I PURCHASED A NEW 2002 PROCRAFT 200 SUPER PRO BASS BOAT AND CUSTOM TRAILER IN APRIL OF 2002. ON AUGUST 22, 2002 AFTER TRAILING THE BOAT I FOUND THAT THE HARDENED BOLT FOR THE SWING-AWAY TONGUE ON MY TRAILER HAD BROKEN SOMETIME WHILE BEING TRAILED. I GOT A REPLACEMENT BOLT FROM MY DEALER AND WAS TOLD BY THE FACTORY TO KEEP THE NUT AND BOLT TIGHT. ON OCTOBER 19, 2002 I RETURNED HOME FROM A FISHING TRIP AND ONCE AGAIN FOUND THE HARDENED BOLT BROKEN AGAIN. THE FACTORY WANTED TO JUST GIVE ME ANOTHER BOLT BUT I REFUSED AND RETURNED THE TRAILER TO MY DEALER FOR PROPER INSPECTION AND REPAIR. THE TRAILER WAS RETURNED TO THE FACTORY ON DECEMBER 5, 2002.  I TOLD MY DEALER AND THE FACTORY SEVERAL TIMES I WAS NOT GOING TO ACCEPT THE TRAILER UNLESS A CAUSE TO THE TWO FAILURES WAS FOUND AND CORRECTIONS WERE MADE AND I WANTED DOCUMENTATION ON ALL FINDINGS AND REPAIRS. I MADE THE DEALER AND THE FACTORY AWARE THAT THE ANCHORING POINT FOR THE SAFETY CHAINS WAS FORWARD OF THE BOLT FOR THE SWING-AWAY TONGUE AND IF THE SWING-AWAY TONGUE WOULD HAVE BROKEN FREE FROM THE TRAILER THE SAFETY CHAINS WOULD HAVE DONE NOTHING BUT HOLD ONTO THE SWING-AWAY TONGUE THAT WOULD STILL BE ATTACHED TO THE TOW VEHICLE. THE BREAK AWAY CORD FOR MY HYDRAULIC BRAKES WOULD HAVE ALSO DONE NO GOOD SINCE THE HYDRAULIC CYLINDER IS LOCATED IN THE SWING-AWAY TONGUE. IF THE TRAILER WOULD SEPARATE AT THE HARDENED BOLT THE HYDRAULICDS WOULD ONLY WORK MOMENTARILY UNTIL THE HYDRAULIC HOSE WOULD BE TORN BY THE TRAILER BREAKING AWAY. AT THE REQUEST OF MY DEALER THE ANCHORING POINT FOR THE SAFETY CHAINS ON MY TRAILER HAVE NOW BEEN RELOCATED TO A POSITION BEHIND THE SWING-AWAY TONGUE HARDENED BOLT HOWEVER WHAT ABOUT THE THOUSANDS OF OTHER TRAILER THE COMPANY HAS MANUFACTURED WITH THE SAFETY CHAIN ANCHORING POINT IN THE POSITION FORWARD OF THE SWING-AWAY TONGUE BOLT. THE COMPANY FORCED ME TO HIRE AN ATTORNEY TO GET THE PAPERWORK I REQUESTED AND THEY DID NOT GIVE A DETERMINATION TO THE FIRST TWO BOLT FAILURES.    *NLM

I RECENTLY DISCOVERED THAT MY 2002 DUNES TOYBOX/TRAILER (MODEL 28F) (VIN [XXX]) DOES NOT MEET THE MANUFACTURERS PUBLISHED SPEC SHEET. THE PUBLISHED DRY HITCH WEIGHT IS 736#; THE ACTUAL DRY HITCH WEIGHT IS APPROXIMATELY 1500#. THE PUBLISHED BOX LENGTH IS 28 FEET, THE ACTUAL BOX LENGTH IS 30 FEET.  THE NUMBER OF AXLES ON A 30 FOOT TRAILER IS PUBLISHED AS 3, MY TRAILER HAS 2.  I PURCHASED THE DUNES TRAILER ON THE BASIS OF THE PUBLISHED DATA, PARTICULARLY THE HITCH WEIGHT.  THE ACTUAL HITCH WEIGHT EXCEEDS THE LIMIT OF MY TOW VEHICLE (AS WELL AS MOST FACTORY EQUIPPED OTHERS) BY 500# OR 50%. I AM UNABLE TO USE THIS TRAILER (AND THERE ARE PROBABLY OTHERS OUT THERE) BECAUSE IT IS UNSAFE TO EXCEED THE LIMITATIONS OF THE TOW VEHICLE.  I BELIEVE THAT THIS TRAILER WAS MANUFACTURED INCORRECTLY. I HAVE ATTEMPTED TO CONTACT THE MANUFACTURER ON SEVERAL OCCASIONS. THEY HAVE BEEN TOTALLY NON-RESPONSIVE. I WISH TO HAVE THE TRAILER REPAIRED OR REPLACED.  DUNES TRAILERS ARE MANUFACTURED BY:  CURTIS INDUSTRIES 351 SOUTH FRANK BLAND SAN BERNARDINO, CA 92408  909-382-4208.     *NLM      INFORMATION REDACTED PURSUANT TO THE FREEDOM OF INFORMATION ACT (FOIA), 5 U.S.C. 552(B)(6).  *TR

ROOF LEAKED ON FIRST MAJOR RAIN STORM FROM ALL OVER, CAUSING CARPETING DAMAGE AND CABINET DAMAGE.  I HAD DROVE BACK TO THE DEALER TO HAVE IT FIXED, AND THEY REPLACED THREE WINDOWS AND FIXED THE ROOF VENT AND REPLACED THE CARPET.  THEY DID NOT FIX THE WATER DAMAGED CABINET, THEY DECIDED TO PUT MOLDING OVER THE STAINED WOOD INSTEAD OF REPLACING.  AFTER I DROVE BACK A WEEK LATER TO PICK UP THE CAMPER, I NOTICED IN THE RAIN ON THE WAY HOME, THAT SOME OF THE FLOOR WAS WET AGAIN.  (500 MILE DRIVE ONE WAY FROM HOME TO THE DEALER) NOW THE FURNACE DOES NOT WORK RIGHT AND ANYTHING THAT IS STEEL IN THE CAMPER STARTED TO CORRODE.  ALSO SOME OF THE CABINET DOORS ARE STARTING TO SEPARATE( I THINK FROM ALL THE MOISTURE).  I ALSO DON'T THINK THE ELECTRIC  BRAKES EVER WORKED.  NOW I ASKED THEM TO BUY THE CAMPER BACK AND THEY STATED THEY WOULD SELL IT ON CONSIGNMENT FOR ME.  BUT THAT MEANS I WOULD LOOSE SEVERAL THOUSAND DOLLARS BECAUSE THEIR CAMPER IS JUNK. NOW MY QUESTION TO YOU IS,  IS THIS RIGHT? OR DO I HAVE A CASE AGAINST SCAMP?  (SCAMP 19FT WHEEL CAR 02).   *SCC   *NLM    **DIMSII IVOQ ENTRY POSTED AFTER 12/12/02 CUT-OVER TO ARTEMIS*770806
MANUFACTURER AND LOCAL RETAILER ( KEN JONES TIRE ) PROVIDED 5 NEW  REPLACEMENTS NO CHARGE. NO SAFETY DEFECT LISTED.  *AK

TWO COMPLETE SETS OF TIRES HAVE BEEN REPLACED  THIS TRAILER HAS A GVW OF 11,080 LBS THE ORIGINAL TIRES WERE A LOAD RANGE D THE SECOND SET WERE A LOAD RANGE E ODD COINCIDENCE FOR TWO SETS TO BE DEFECTIVE TRAILER MANUFACTURER HAS BEEN AVOIDING THE ISSUE THE TRAILER DEALER HAS BEEN MAKING EVERY ATTEMPT TO CORRECT THE PROBLEM THE TRAILER MANUFACTURER HAS NOT OFFERED ANY SUPPORT TO EITHER MYSELF OR THE DEALER I FEEL THEY HAVE CREATED THIS PROBLEM AND SHOULD HAVE SOME OBLIGATION TO MAKE FORMAL ATTEMPT TO INVESTIGATE AND CORRECT THE DESIGN FLAWS THAT THEY HAVE CREATED.  *AK

I WANT TO URGE YOU TO BAN DAZZLING BLUE HID LIGHTS ON ALL HIGHWAY VEHICLES.  THEY ARE DANGEROUS ENOUGH IN ONCOMING TRAFFIC SITUATIONS, BUT EVEN WORSE IS WHEN AN SUV EQUIPPED WITH DAZZLING BLUE HID HEADLIGHTS COMES UP BEHIND ME AT NIGHT.  TURNING THE REAR VIEW MIRROR DOWN IS TOTALLY INEFFECTIVE.  THE INTERIOR OF MY TOYOTA COROLLA IS BRILLIANTLY LIT -- LIKE DRIVING AT NIGHT WITH A LARGE, HIGH INTENSITY DOME LIGHT ON.  IN TWO MEMORABLE INSTANCES, I LOOKED BACK INTO THE LANE BESIDE ME, SIGNALLED, THEN CHANGED LANES -- ONLY TO BE HONKED AT BY A FAST-MOVING CAR IN THAT OTHER LANE -- A CAR THAT I NEVER SAW BECAUSE OF THE BLINDING BLUE LIGHT.  WORST OF ALL IS THE FEELING OF PANIC AND ANGER THAT I FEEL WHEN PLACED IN THAT SITUATION.  I HAVE DRIVEN 75 MILES DAILY TO SAN DIEGO AND BACK FOR 10 YEARS, AND I HAVE NEVER FELT THE SORT OF PANIC AND ANGER THAT I FEEL WHEN AN SUV WITH HID LIGHTS COMES UP BEHIND ME AT NIGHT, RIDING MY TAIL.  THE MORE OF THESE HAZARDOUS LIGHTS THAT SHOW UP ON THE ROAD, THE MORE DANGEROUS THE CONDITION WILL BE.  PLEASE BAN THESE TERRIBLE LIGHTS FROM THE HIGHWAYS, I BEG OF YOU!*AK

ON JULY 4, 2002, AROUND 11:30 PM, WE WERE DRIVING TO BOSTON, SOUTHBOUND ON RTE. 128 (MASSACHUSETTS), NEAR EXIT 44-DANVERS, WE TRY TO SHIFT INTO 5TH GEAR AND SUDDENLY LOST SHIFTING ABILITY IN ALL GEARS, IN TRAFFIC, WITH CARS TRAVELING UPWARDS OF 70 MPH AROUND US.  STUCK IN NEUTRAL, WE MANAGE TO PULL ONTO THE RIGHT SHOULDER, AND CALL MINI ROADSIDE ASSISTANCE.  RAY, OUR OPERATOR, TELLS US THE TOW TRUCK WILL TAKE 60-90 MINUTES.  HE CAN OFFER NO ASSISTANCE REGARDING A REPAIR.*AK

TIRES BLEW OUT ON 3 DIFFERENT OCCASIONS WITHIN 1 1/2 YEARS OF OWNING THE TRAILER. TIRES DIDN'T JUST GO FLAT, THEY EXPLODED. SINCE HAVING THESE EMERGENCY SITUATIONS HAPPEN TO ME, 5 OTHER PERSONAL FRIENDS WITH WARRIOR TRAILERS AND IDENTICAL TIRES, HAVE HAD ALL THEIR TIRES FAIL. ALL WITHIN 2 YEARS OF OWNING THESE TRAILERS. AS OF TODAYS DATE, NONE OF OUR TRAILERS ARE OLDER THAN 2 YEARS. NEITHER MANUFACTURER, WARRIOR TRAILERS NOR CARLISLE TIRES WILL WARRANT TIRES UNLESS I HAVE OLD ONES TO TRADE FOR. UNFORTUNATELY I DID NOT KNOW I NEEDED TO SAVE AN EXPLODED TIRE FOR THEIR WARRANTY. I ASSUMED MY RECEIPTS FOR PURCHASE OF NEW TIRES WOULD BE ENOUGH. WARRIOR ADMITTED TO BUILDING 1,400 UNITS PER YEAR. IF 100% OF THE PEOPLE I KNOW, WHICH IS FIVE, HAVE HAD DISASTROUS RESULTS FROM THIS TIRE AND TRAILER COMBO, I PERSONALLY BELIEVE THEIR IS A SERIOUS SAFETY ISSUE HERE. THANK YOU, SINCERELY [XXX].  *AK    PARTS OF THIS DOCUMENT HAVE BEEN REDACTED TO PROTECT PERSONALLY IDENTIFIABLE INFORMATION PURSUANT TO THE FREEDOM OF INFORMATION ACT (FOIA), 5 U.S.C. 552(B)(6).
THIS LEFT THE CAR STUCK IN 5TH GEAR. HAD THIS OCCURRED WHILE IN HEAVY TRAFFIC, AN ACCIDENT MAY HAVE RESULTED. MANY OWNERS ARE REPORTING SIMILAR FAILURE.*AK

RH REAR WHEEL WELL--PROPANE LINES ARE APPROX 4 INCHES FROM THE TIRES WIT NO PROTECTION. A BLOW OUT OR TREAD SEPARATION WOULD PROBABLY CAUSE AN EXPLOSION.  LH WHEEL WELL-GASOLINE FILLER TUBE IS APPROX 7 INCHES FROM THE TIRES WITH NO PROTECTION. A BLOW OUT OR TREAD SEPARATION COULD CAUSE AN EXPLOSION.*AK

CONSULTING FIRM ZOOK, MOORE AND ASSOCIATES, INC. HAS BEEN RETAINED TO INVESTIGATE A FATAL ACCIDENT INVOLVING SUDDEN ACCELERATION OF A MOTORCYCLE "TRIKE" UPON ENGINE START-UP. THE VEHICLE WAS MANUFACTURED BY THE TRIKE SHOP, NHTSA MANUFACTURER CODE 1T9-555, MANUFACTURED IN WHITE BEAR LAKE, MN  PHONE 1-800-331-0705. THE VEHICLE'S MANUFACTURER HAS FAILED TO COMPLY WITH 49 CFR 571.122, 571.123, AND SAE RECOMMENDED PRACTICE J107. THE MANUFACTURER ALSO FAILED TO PROVIDE A CLUTCH INTERLOCK, WHICH IS NOT REQUIRED BY FEDERAL REGULATION OR INDUSTRIAL STANDARD BUT IS COMMONLY PROVIDED BY MOTOR VEHICLE MANUFACTURERS TO PREVENT ACCIDENTS SUCH AS THE PRESENT CASE. ZOOK, MOORE AND ASSOCIATES, INC. HAS DETAILED INFORMATION ON THE SUBJECT VEHICLE INCLUDING INSPECTION NOTES, PHOTOGRAPHS AND VIDEOTAPE, TEST RESULTS OF SUDDEN ACCELERATION UPON ENGINE START-UP, POLICE REPORT, AND WITNESS STATEMENTS. INTERESTS OF THE DECEDENT'S FAMILY ARE REPRESENTED BY ATTORNEY DEBORAH BLUE, DICKINSON AND GIBBONS, P.A. PHONE (941) 366-4680. PLEASE REPLY TO ALAN MOORE, ZOOK, MOORE AND ASSOCIATES, INC., AT (407) 645-1896.*AK

THE NEW HIGH INTENSITY DISCHARGE LIGHTS THAT ARE BECOMING POPULAR ON BMW'S, AUDIS, AND OTHER MAKES AS WELL AS AS A RETROFIT POSE A DISTINCT HAZARD ON OUR ROADS.  THESE LIGHTS CREATE AN INORDINATE AMOUNT OF GLARE, BOTH FOR ON-COMING DRIVERS AS WELL AS THROUGH THE REAR VIEW WINDOW FOR DRIVERS UNFORTUNATE ENOUGH TO BE CAUGHT IN FRONT OF VEHICLES WITH THESE NOXIOUS LIGHTS.  I WOULD RATHER FACE A CAR WITH CONVENTIONAL LIGHTS ON HIGH RATHER THAN ENCOUNTER A VEHICLE WITH THEIR HIGH INTENSITY DISCHARGE LIGHTS SET ON NORMAL.  THESE LIGHTS NEED TO BE ELIMINATED FROM OUR NATION'S HIGHWAYS.  THEY NEED TO BE BANNED FROM ALL NEW PRODUCTION CARS AND BANNED AS AN AFTER-MARKET PRODUCT.  THERE IS NO RATIONAL JUSTIFICATION FOR THESE LIGHTS.  I AM 50 YEARS OLD AND KNOW THAT THE HUMAN EYE IS MORE SENSITIVE TO GLARE AS IT AGES.  I CAN NOT IMAGINE WHAT THESE LIGHTS DO TO THOSE IN THEIR 60'S OR 70'S.  ARE WE TO SACRIFICE SAFETY SO THOSE WHO WANT THEIR VEHICLES TO STAND OUT MAY INFLICT THIS LIGHT POLLUTION ON THE REST OF THE POPULATION?*AK

I BELIEVE THAT THE USE OF THE NEW HIGH INTENISITY HEADLIGHTS USED ON SUVS AND TRUNKS IS PROVIDING A HAZZARD TO OTHER DRIVERS.  MOST SUV & TRUNK HEADLIGHTS ARE SET TOO HIGH AND COUPLED WITH THE NEW LIGHTS, THOSE OF US IN STANDARD SIGNS CARS ARE BLINDED WHEN THESE HEADLIGHTS HIT US STRAIGHT IN THE EYE.  I HAVE HAD TO DRIVE WITH NO REVIEW MIRROR BECAUSE OF THE HEADLIGHTS IN THE REAR OF ME AND DRIVE WITH MY HAND BLOCKING THE LIGHTS WHEN THEY ARE COMING AT ME.  THIS CAUSES A VERY UNSAFE CONDITION.  THE NHTSA MUST PUT REGULATIONS IN PLACE AND INFORCE THEM TO CORRECT THIS CONDITION.*AK

I'M NOTICING MANY CARS WITH VERY BRIGHT HEADLIGHTS. THEY SEEM TO BE ON IMPORT CARS SUCH AS BMW, MERCEDES AND AUDI MOSTLY, AND THEY HAVE A BLUE TINT. THEY ARE TOO BRIGHT, BLINDING BOTH ONCOMING TRAFFIC AND VEHICLES THAT THEY ARE FOLLOWING. I THINK THERE SHOULD BE A LIMIT TO HOW BRIGHT A HEADLIGHT CAN BE. SORRY IF THIS IS THE WRONG PLACE TO REPORT THIS KIND OF PROBLEM -- YOUR FORM ASKS ALL KINDS OF VEHICLE-SPECIFIC INFORMATION -- PERHAPS A GENERAL COMMENT AREA EARLY IN THE FORM WOULD BE BETTER.*AK

I'M CONSISTENTLY BEING BLINDED BY THE HIGH-POWER, BLUISH HEADLIGHTS ON EUROPEAN-MANUFACTURED VEHICLES. IN ADDITION, SPORT UTILITY VEHICLES (SUVS) HEADLIGHTS ARE AT A GROUND HEIGHT WHICH MAKES THEM SHINE DIRECTLY INTO THE PASSENGER COMPARTMENT OF A TYPICAL PASSENGER VEHICLE. PLEASE INVESTIGATE MY STATEMENTS, AS THE PROBLEM APPEARS TO BE GETTING WORSE!  *AK

THE NEW BLUE HIGH INTENSITY LIGHTS ARE VERY BLINDING IN MANY HIGHWAY SITUATIONS. THE HEIGHT OF PICKUP TRUCKS AND SPORTS UTILITY VEHICLES MAKES IT ESPECIALLY BLINDING IF YOU ARE IN A CONVERSION SIZE CAR.  ON A RECENT NIGHT TIME DRIVE ON A TWO LANE HIGHWAY THAT GOES UP AND DOWN OVER THE DESERT TERRAIN.  WHEN A VEHICLE WITH THE NEW TYPE HEADLIGHTS IS COMING OVER A RISE TOWARDS YOU , OR AROUND A SLIGHT CURVE  YOU CAN BE SET UP WITH THE LIGHTS DIRECTLY INTO YOUR EYES.  ON A DARK 2 LANE HIGHWAY AT NIGHT  IT IS LIKE A PHOTO FLASH IN YOUR EYES.  THESE LIGHTS SHOULD BE LIMITED TO VEHICLES WITH AUTOMATIC AIMING TECHNOLGY SO A HEAVY TRUNK LOAD OR TRAILER WON'T AIM THEM HIGHER.  IN THE CITY THEY ARE ANNOYING BUT DON'T SEEM TO BLIND YOU AS MUCH BECAUSE OF THE STREET LIGHTING AND MOST OF THE ROADS ARE LEVEL.   PLEASE CONSIDER LOWERING THE HEADLIGHT HEIGHT ON SUV'S AND PICK UP TRUCKS TO 39.*AKY
